page.title: 01BURTON SALMON INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area of our survey is based upon the pleasant village of Burton Salmon. This part of the West Riding is administered by North Yorkshire County Council. It is in the fertile Vale of York and so most of the land is used for arable agriculture. The skyline is dominated by Betteras Hill to the north and the power stations of Ferrybridge, Drax, and Eggborough to the south and east.Power lines cross the area carrying electricity for the National Grid. The railway traffic through the area is mainly trains carrying coal to feed the power stations. The main road through the area takes traffic to or from the A1. The A1 road passes through this area for about 1/4 of a mile.
